Corpus: Annotated Corpus of Czech Case Law for Reference Recognition Tasks
Annotation: legal references (identifier of court decision; author of law book or article, etc.)
Description: This corpus consists of 350 manually annotated decision at Czech top-tier courts (Supreme Court, Supreme Administrative Court, Constitutional Court). Each decision has been manually annotated by two trained annotators; the corpus is primarily developed as training and testing materials for reference recognition tasks. See also the variant of this corpus annotated for segmentation tasks.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from LINDAT.

This corpus contains transcriptions of court decisions from three top-tier courts (Supreme, Supreme Administrative, and Constitutional) in Czechia, published between 1993 and 2018.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from LINDAT.

Annotation: manual syntactic annotation; manual annotation of entities from the accouting domain and relations definition, obligation, right
Description: This corpus consists of two legal documents: Accounting Act (563/1991 Coll., as amended) and Decree on Double-entry Accounting for undertakers (500/2002 Coll., as amended).#SEPThe corpus is available for download from LINDAT and online browsing through the treebank viewer PML-TQ and the concordancer KonText.
This is a subcorpus of the META-NORD Acquis Parallel Treebank.#SEPThe corpus is available for download and online browsing through INESS (CLARINO).
This corpus contains legal texts from 1814 to 1989, compiled year by year.#SEPThe corpus is available for online browsing on a dedicated webpage

Corpus: CABank English SCOTUS Oral Arguments Corpus
Description: This corpus consists of transcripts and recordings of oral arguments at the Supreme Court of the United States.#SEPThe transcripts and audio recordings are aligned at the utterance level; the utterances are annotated based on speaker role (the primary one being Justice) and name, as well as gender.#SEPThe corpus is part of the CABank collection and available for download from and online browsing through TalkBank.

Corpus: The English Sub-corpus of MULCOLD, Multilingual Parallel Corpus of Legal Texts
Description: This corpus, which is a subcorpus of MULCOLD (see also the Parallel corpora resource family) contains international conventions and treaties.#SEPThe corpus is available for online browsing through the concordancer Korp (FIN-CLARIN Distribution).
This corpus contains selected texts from the Acquis Communautaire between the 1950s and today, translated to English.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from PORTULAN.

This historical corpus consists of Proceedings of the Old Bailey; the Old Bailey was London’s central criminal court between 1674 and 1913. The corpus consists of texts from 1970 to 1913, and is annotated for detailed utterance-level sociolinguistic annotation at the following three levels: sociobiographical speaker information (gender, age, occupation, social class), pragmatic information (speaker role in the courtroom such as judge, witness, etc.), and metatextual information (the scribe, printer, and publisher of the individual Proceeding).#SEPThe corpus is available for download from CLARIN-D (Saarland University) and for online browsing through CQPWeb.

This corpus contains Estonian laws (1.8 million tokens) as well as European legislation (9.6 million tokens) translated into Estonian.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from a dedicated webpage hosted by CLARIN Estonia.
This is a subcorpus of the META-NORD Acquis Parallel Treebank.#SEPThe corpus is available for download and online browsing through INESS (CLARINO).

Corpus: The Finnish Sub-corpus of FiRuLex, Russian-Finnish Comparable Corpus of Legal Texts
Description: This is the Finnish subcorpus of FiRuLex, Russian-Finnish Comparable Corpus of Legal Texts, which contains juridical texts in Russian and Finnish.#SEPThe corpus is available for online browsing through the concordancer Korp (FIN-CLARIN distribution)

Corpus: The Finnish Sub-corpus of the JRC-Acquis Multilingual Parallel Corpus, Downloadable Version
Description: This is a legal subcorpus of the Helsinki Korp Version of the Finnish TreeBank 3.#SEPThe corpus is available for online browsing through the concordancer Korp (FIN-CLARIN distribution) and for download from the Finnish Language Bank.

This is a subcorpus of the META-NORD Acquis Parallel Treebank. The corpus is syntactically parsed using the FinnTreeBank 2 schema and is available for download and online browsing through INESS (CLARINO).

Corpus: The German Sub-corpus of MULCOLD, Multilingual Parallel Corpus of Legal Texts
Description: This corpus, which is a subcorpus of MULCOLD (see also the Parallel corpora resource family) contains international conventions and treaties.#SEPThe corpus is available for online browsing through the concordancer Korp (FIN-CLARIN Distribution).

Corpus: Corpus of Judicial Rhetoric: cases of rapes and homicides
Description: This corpus consists of transcriptions of defendants’ and witnesses’ speeches in criminal cases of rape, attempted rape, murder, and attempted murder.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from the CLARIN:EL repository.
This is a subcorpus of the META-NORD Acquis Parallel Treebank.#SEPThe corpus is available for download and online browsing through INESS (CLARINO).

Corpus: IGC-Laws-21.05 (The Icelandic Gigaword Corpus: Law, bills and proposals)
Description: IGC-Laws is a part of the IGC-project (The Icelandic Gigaword Corpus; see also CLARIN reference corpora) that aims to collect as much as possible of Icelandic texts that can be published under an open or restricted license. IGC-Laws contains 1) the Icelandic laws, 2) explanatory reports and observations extracted from bills submitted to Althingi, and 3) parliamentary proposals and resolutions. The corpus comes in two formats. One contains the texts untokenized and untagged while the other has been tokenized, PoS-tagged and lemmatized.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from the CLARIN-IS repository.

Corpus: Lithuanian Corpus of the EU Primary and Secondary Law Acts of the Period 2015–2017
Description: This corpus contains primary and secondary European law acts (32 texts) translated into Lithuanian.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from CLARIN-LT.
This corpus contains selected texts from the Acquis Communautaire between the 1950s and today, translated to Maltese.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from PORTULAN.
This is a subcorpus of the META-NORD Acquis Parallel Treebank.#SEPThe corpus is available for download and online browsing through INESS (CLARINO).
This corpus contains Norwegian translations of 5414 documents in Acquis Communautaire.#SEPThe corpus is available for download from the Norwegian Language Bank.

Corpus: Legal Documents from Norwegian Nynorsk Municipialities
Description: This corpus contains 50,000 legal documents and meeting minutes collected with the web crawler Veidemann. Around 88.5 million words are in Nynork, while the rest are in Bokmal (Bokmål).#SEPThe corpus is available for download from the Norwegian Language Bank.

Corpus: The Russian Sub-corpus of MULCOLD, Multilingual Parallel Corpus of Legal Texts
Description: This corpus, which is a subcorpus of MULCOLD (see also the Parallel corpora resource family) contains international conventions and treaties.#SEPThe corpus can be accessed online through the concordancer Korp (FIN-CLARIN Distribution).

Corpus: The Russian Sub-corpus of FiRuLex, Russian-Finnish Comparable Corpus of Legal Texts
Description: This is the Russian subcorpus of FiRuLex, Russian-Finnish Comparable Corpus of Legal Texts, which contains juridical texts in Russian and Finnish.#SEPThe corpus is available for online browsing through the concordancer Korp (FIN-CLARIN distribution)
This is a subcorpus of the META-NORD Acquis Parallel Treebank.#SEPThe corpus is available for download and online browsing through INESS (CLARINO).
